RainbruRPG::Core::HighlightQueueListener

RainbruRPG::Core::HighlightQueueListener Class Reference

#include <highlightlistener.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Used to highlight an entity in the editor.

This class is used by the Editor to highlight an object. To use it, you must first register this listener : 

 // mSceneMgr if a Ogre::SceneManager instance
 mSceneMgr->addRenderQueueListener(new HighlightQueueListener());

Then you can setup an entity to be highlighted ( A material called Outline must exist): 

 entity->setRenderQueueGroup(90);
 Ogre::Entity* clone = entity->clone(entity->getName() + "Outline");
 clone->setRenderQueueGroup(91);
 clone->setMaterialName("Outline");

 Ogre::SceneNode* high = entity->getParentSceneNode()
   ->createChildSceneNode(parent->getName() + "Outline");
 high->setScale(Ogre::Vector3(1.1,1.1,1.1));
 high->attachObject(clone);

This code was found in the Ogre forum : http://www.ogre3d.org/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=25321

Member Function Documentation

void RainbruRPG::Core::HighlightQueueListener::renderQueueStarted ( Ogre::uint8  queueGroupId,
const Ogre::String &  invocation,
bool &  skipThisInvocation 
) [virtual]

The Ogre renderQueueStarted implementation.

The more used parameter is the queueGroupId. 90 is for the object to be highlighted, 91 is its outline.

Parameters:
queueGroupId The queue group identifier (90 and 91 are treated)
invocation Unused Ogre provided parameter
skipThisInvocation Unused Ogre provided parameter
